intro: Oncinotis subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oncinotis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and sessile, with a distinctive silvery underside. Oncinotis subsessilis blooms in late spring to early summer, producing small, greenish-white flowers that attract pollinators like bees and flies.
